result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole Steel Soman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cole Steel Soman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cole Steel Soman in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called @ 3:05 p.m. Statement by Atty Erickson. Agreement stated - Amended information filed. Def will plead to both misd counts as amended. Withheld sentence, 18 months probation, concurrent to any other probation, costs, DNA surcharge, AODA, absolute sobriety, controlled substances taken only as prescribed. Atty Erickson and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Court grants motion to amend cts 1 & 2. Plea to amended cts - no contest. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Erickson satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of ct 1 poss THC and ct 2 possession of controlled substance. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Orders ct 1 - sentence withheld, 12 months probation, court costs, DNA surcharge, sample if not already on file, at discretion of officer - AODA, counseling. Absolute sobriety. Ct 2- withheld sentence, 12 months probation, same conditions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Credit for 1 day if revoked. Postconviction rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 18, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Lindsay L Erickson in court by phone.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Statement by Atty Erickson.  State request matter be set for plea sentencing.  Additional statement by Atty Erickson.  Court feels matter should be set for trial.  Response by Atty Erickson.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cole Steel Soman in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 10:51 am.  Atty Erickson waives p.h.  State gives promise that made with Atty Erickson while negotiating case.  Court goes over with Written Preliminary Examination form.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Information Filed.  Atty Erickson has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights and enters Not Guilty plea to both ct's. Court receives Not Guilty plea to both ct's and directs Clerk to enter. Atty Erickson can appear by phone for Status.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Lindsay L Erickson in court by phone.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 3:11 pm.  Atty Erickson requesting an adjournment, reason given, medical.  Court will grant adjournment.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Cole Steel Soman in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint received, waive reading.  Preliminary hearing requested,  Time limits waived.   Penalties reviewed.  Court reviews time limits for preliminary with def.  Def waive time limits for preliminary.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
